intro: Corydalis diphylla, commonly known as the two-leaved Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has two distinct leaves, one at the base and one at the top of the stem, giving it its common name. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Corydalis diphylla is also valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its visual appeal.
